message.content:
An American Chameleon is a species of lizards found primarily in North America. 
Their body is roughly the size of a hand and features a long, pointed tail. 
Their skin is covered in small, granular scales that provide a bumpy appearance and a rough texture. 
Their coloration is highly variable, ranging from shades of green, brown, and blue to orange, yellow, and black. 
American Chameleons are arboreal, meaning they live in trees and shrubs, and are adept at blending into their surroundings due to their ability to change color. 
They are primarily active during the day and feed on a variety of insects and other small invertebrates. 
American Chameleons are commonly found in areas with plenty of vegetation, such as forests, woodlands, and gardens.
